title: MFK Treska
text:
FK Makedonija Gjorče Petrov 1932 (), until 2012 known as MFK Treska () is a <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club based in the <a href="Gjor%C4%8De%20Petrov%2C%20Skopje">Gjorče Petrov neighborhood</a>, formerly in the village of <a href="%C5%A0i%C5%A1evo">Šiševo</a> near <a href="Skopje">Skopje</a>, <a href="Republic%20of%20Macedonia">Republic of Macedonia</a>.
History.
The club was founded in 1982.
Since <a href="FK%20Makedonija%20Gjor%C4%8De%20Petrov">Makedonija Gjorče Petrov</a> was abolished in the <a href="First%20Macedonian%20Football%20League">First League</a> in the <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20First%20Macedonian%20Football%20League">2009–10</a> season, the club was unable to participate at the top level. Therefore, the club's board took over MFK Treska from the nearby village of Šiševo, moved the team to the <a href="Gjor%C4%8De%20Petrov%20Stadium">Gjorče Petrov Stadium</a>. Before the takeover by <a href="FK%20Makedonija%20Gjor%C4%8De%20Petrov">Makedonija Gjorče Petrov</a>' head office, their home games were played at the Šiševo football field. At the season 2011-12, the club started as FK Treska and at the mid season changed the name into Makedonija Gjorče Petrov 1932.
